location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.3241 of 1855 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of receipt of Kemballâ€™s earlier letter (folios 20-21) with his explanations relating to the Arab slave trade. Anderson writes that His Lordship in Council is highly satisfied with the assurance of cordial relations with the Persian Government over the suppression of the slave trade, and recommends a gift of sorts be made to the Persian Slave Trade Commissioner, Meerza Mahmood Khan.
